text: this is abdul wahid Wafaa reporting from
kabul from a distance it could pass for
a street party
but out close it looks more like a
street fun this is our Shura a holy day
throughout the Muslim work especially an
emotional one for shears who wept
themselves with chains topped with sharp
knives
it is self-flagellation to the point of
blood and it symbolizes the martyrdom of
Prophet Muhammad's grandsons this public
display was unimaginable during the
Taliban when Afghanistan Shia minority
were heavily persecuted now I sure is
one of many examples of new freedoms
here security is a serious concern and
this year too sheer gatherings in
Pakistan were bombed after the beatings
she residents drive in convoys through
the streets of Kabul they also visit
mosques and holy shrines Iraq hosts the
largest Ashura gathering but most half
on Shias are too poor for the pilgrimage
so this is their own creation
the beatings are controversial some see
the Brett role as a primitive act with
serious health risks the men rinse their
blades in a common water bakit and then
continue the webbings the risk spreading
blood-borne diseases like hepatitis in
Iraq leaders have spoken out against the
beatings in Iran they banned altogether
but in Afghanistan tradition is never so
easy to overturn
